meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or derived from citrus fruits.
meanings.sent1: The citric aroma of the orange filled the room.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the refreshing taste of the citric lemonade.
meanings.sent3: The citric orange made a sour face when it realized it was a fruit.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright and citric as a freshly squeezed lemon.
meanings.sent5: The citric colors of the sunset painted the sky in shades of orange and yellow.

meanings.sent1: The citric juice was used to marinate the chicken.
meanings.sent2: The citric flavor of the soda came from the added citric acid.
meanings.sent3: The citric acid and the base had a sour argument in the chemistry lab.
meanings.sent4: His words were as sharp and citric as the acid in the lemon.
meanings.sent5: The citric acid in the fruits helped preserve them for a longer time.

meanings.definition: Having a sour or acidic taste.
meanings.sent1: The citric taste of the vinegar made her pucker her lips.
meanings.sent2: The salad dressing had a tangy, citric flavor.
meanings.sent3: The citric lemon joked that it was the sourest fruit in the bowl.
meanings.sent4: Her words had a citric edge that left a bitter aftertaste.
meanings.sent5: The citric sensation on his tongue reminded him of biting into a fresh lime.
